nodes.bodyText: We should use the latest version of the lib that is com.github.bumptech.glide:glide:4.11.0.

nodes.bodyText: There is no Package name of androidx.core.widget.Space may leads to the app crash, we should use Space instated.
This class is never used, we can remove this.
no need to pass the ref as code check-out to the particular commit in any case @ line 27
try to run the test without runOnUiThread, tests are running locally.
try to run the test without runOnUiThread, tests are running locally.

Without this statement here's the exception that gets raised:
CalledFromWrongThreadException: Only the original thread that created a view hierarchy can touch its views.
From which statements these comments are linked?

+     * AssertJ has been deprecated and doesn't support AndroidX classes.

+     * Instead of AssertJ we should move towards Truth library that they recommend instead.
+     * Ref: https://truth.dev/comparison.html
+     */

nodes.bodyText:
Square's AssertJ library that we are using, which has been deprecated in favor of Truth
p.s. the statement to which this comment is linked:

         Line 229
      in
      5ace7c9

nodes.bodyText: Please mention the purpose/inspiration ref for these changes.
SUPPORT_LIBRARY_VERSION not used anymore, also we need to add a new constant to represent the androidX Library version.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -115,12 +113,12 @@ dependencies {
     // with module updates.
     implementation project (':android-iconify-fontawesome')
 
-    implementation "com.android.support:appcompat-v7:${SUPPORT_LIBRARY_VERSION}"
-    implementation "com.android.support:recyclerview-v7:${SUPPORT_LIBRARY_VERSION}"
-    implementation "com.android.support:cardview-v7:${SUPPORT_LIBRARY_VERSION}"
-    implementation "com.android.support:design:${SUPPORT_LIBRARY_VERSION}"

+    implementation "androidx.cardview:cardview:1.0.0"

     // For the optional Nullable annotation
-    implementation "com.android.support:support-annotations:${SUPPORT_LIBRARY_VERSION}"
+    implementation "androidx.annotation:annotation:1.0.0"
